body.name: Reborn as a Space Mercenary: I Woke Up Piloting the Strongest Starship! Vol. 6: Light Novel
body.description: HOLDING OUT FOR A HEROWith the mechanic twins aboard, Hiro and crew accept a transport job that takes them to a new star system...where they run right into a skirmish between Empire ships and the hostile crystal lifeforms. Hiro charges in to save the day, but gets more than he bargained for when he draws the attention of military VIPs. Worse yet, Lieutenant Commander Serena now has a new request: a deadly raid on a galaxy swarming with battleship-sized crystal lifeforms! Read more

productInformation.name: Publisher
productInformation.value: Seven Seas Entertainment, Seven Seas Siren

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic book! I loved this book! Such amazing character development. I simply can not wait for the next book to come out!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Series continues to be a lot of fun!
reviews.reviewText: Glad I found this series which continues to impress with each volume. Quite different than other isaki of late, and a fun mix of characters as the story grows.Hope that the author has many more in the future!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoy this series. Usually the market is flooded with fantasy tales. So getting a sci-fi and space adventure its truly a great change up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great read, slight translation error
reviews.reviewText: To keep it simpleAs someone who used to play space sims/rpgs its an AMAZING readTranslation could have been improved by changing "battleship" to "combat ship." Character identifies his ship around a light cruiser/cruiser yet when referencing his ship throughout the story he calls it a "battleship." very slight annoyance to consistency but otherwise great, i dont think many people would be bothered by it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I want more volume
reviews.reviewText: I like the pacing of the story, and the character is great . its too short because I enjoy reading it to much lol . waiting eagerly for volume 7

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a fine addition to the series
reviews.reviewText: I’m really liking this series so far and this latest book didn’t disappoint, a good mix of combat situations and relationship development. I’ll be eagerly waiting for the next book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Awesome new installment of the series looking forward to where it goes next, as always he is a trouble magnet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining quick read
reviews.reviewText: The story continues. No space pirates this time, but silica based aliens and large scale battles with out hero Hiro playing a key role on the Empire's side. We do get to meet Serena again, who to our gang's suspicions seems to have lost some of her obsession with recruiting Hiro. Much like earlier volumes, an entertaining albeit simple light hearted story with likeable characters and decent enough world building. If you got this far in the series, the lack of genuine threat to our MC should not come as a surprise. So, a fun read as expected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Honestly this is the series that keeps on giving, mind that doesn't mean it's repetitive. Even if you've read the WN there's still bits and pieces that help increase the entertainment of volume, looking forward to how the next arc goes!!!!!
